questions.question: Please don’t use your nail …………. a screwdriver.
questions.description: We use ‘as’ to say what function a person or object has.

questions.question: I don’t like people …………… me in the middle of the night.
questions.description: Like can be followed by an ing form or a to-infinitive.

questions.question: I will let you …………….. my holiday dates next week.
questions.description: Let is followed by an infinitive without to.

questions.question: They kept watch all night lest the robbers ……………. come.
questions.description: Should is the only auxiliary that can be used after lest.

questions.question: I am going to ………….. down for a few minutes.
questions.description: To lie is to be horizontal.

questions.question: I earn ………………. in my family.
questions.description: The least is the superlative of little. It is used before uncountable nouns.

questions.question: Those who know the answer should ………….. their hands.
questions.description: We use raise with an object.

questions.question: She ……………. from her seat.
questions.description: To rise from your seat is to get up.

questions.question: I am very sure ……………… the test.
questions.description: We use sure + infinitive  to talk about our own feelings.

questions.question: She seemed quite sure …………. the exam.
questions.description: Sure + of + ing is used to refer to the feelings of the person you are talking about.

questions.question: I am sorry ……………. my temper yesterday.
questions.description: Sorry + about/for + ing is used to talk about past things we regret.

questions.question: I am sorry …………… you that you failed the test.
questions.description: Sorry + infinitive is used to apologize for current situations.
